section_title: B.4 Supervised UNSAT-Core and Backbone Prediction
section_purpose: To describe the setup, training, and evaluation of supervised GNN models used as baselines for UNSAT-core and backbone prediction tasks, which are compared against the RLAF-based policies in the main experiments.
key_points: The supervised GNN models for UNSAT-core and backbone prediction have the same architecture and size as the GNNs used in the RLAF-based policies.
The hyperparameters for training these supervised models are specified in a separate table (Table 4).
The section provides detailed descriptions of the training and evaluation processes for these models.

architectures: GNN models (identical in architecture and size to the RLAF policy models)

hyperparameters.reference: Table 4 (details not provided in the snippet)

dependencies: Appendix A.1 and A.2 (Graph Representation and Architecture, Message-Passing Neural Network)
reproducibility_notes: Architecture and size of the GNN models must match those used in RLAF policies.
Hyperparameters from Table 4 are required for training.
Detailed training and evaluation procedure described in the full section.
